text: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
author: Baltasar Gracián

text: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
author: Jerome

text: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
author: William Arthur Ward

text: False friendship, like the ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports.
author: Richard Burton

text: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
author: Aristotle

text: A friend in power is a friend lost.
author: Henry Adams

text: Rock n' roll as a genre is different from pop and hip hop: it is about bands, and that for me suggests brotherhood, family, friendship and community.
author: Steven Van Zandt

text: All I required to be happy was friendship and people I could admire.
author: Christian Dior

text: Your friend is your needs answered.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
author: Chanakya

text: Value your friendship. Value your relationships.
author: Barbara Bush

text: We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
author: Jim Morrison

text: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
author: Doug Larson

text: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
author: Epicurus

text: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
author: Voltaire

text: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.
author: Herodotus

text: Love is flower like; Friendship is like a sheltering tree.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

text: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
author: Mencius

text: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
author: Elie Wiesel

text: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
author: Jane Austen

text: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

text: A quarrel between friends, when made up, adds a new tie to friendship.
author: Francis de Sales

text: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.
author: Ovid

text: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: It is only the great hearted who can be true friends. The mean and cowardly, can never know what true friendship means.
author: Charles Kingsley

text: Love is a friendship set to music.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
author: Basil of Caesarea

text: Friendship, like credit, is highest when it is not used.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
author: Octavia E. Butler

text: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

text: True friendship is a plant of slow growth, and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity, before it is entitled to the appellation.
author: George Washington

text: Forgiveness is that subtle thread that binds both love and friendship. Without forgiveness, you may not even have a child one day.
author: George Foreman

text: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
author: George Santayana

text: Friendship increases in visiting friends, but in visiting them seldom.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Friendship needs no words - it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
author: Dag Hammarskjöld

text: Rejoicing in our joy, not suffering over our suffering, makes someone a friend.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
author: Orson Welles

text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Friendship is almost always the union of a part of one mind with the part of another; people are friends in spots.
author: George Santayana

text: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
author: Marcel Proust

text: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Love, friendship and respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.
author: Anton Chekhov

text: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, sir, should keep his friendship in a constant repair.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Friendship often ends in love, but love in friendship - never.
author: Albert Camus

text: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.
author: John Locke

text: Friendship may, and often does, grow into love, but love never subsides into friendship.
author: Lord Byron

text: Friendship is essentially a partnership.
author: Aristotle

text: Friendship always benefits; love sometimes injures.
author: Seneca the Younger

text: Love demands infinitely less than friendship.
author: George Jean Nathan

text: Love and friendship exclude each other.
author: Jean de La Bruyère

text: Friendship is Love without his wings!
author: Lord Byron

text: Marriage: A friendship recognized by the police.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.
author: Hubert Humphrey

text: Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

text: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
author: Jerome

text: The differences between friends cannot but reinforce their friendship.
author: Mao Zedong

text: Every friendship is different because everyone's personality is different.
author: Nargis Fakhri

text: The world is round so that friendship may encircle it.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

text: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.
author: Mortimer J. Adler

text: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.
author: Cicero

text: Love is rarer than genius itself. And friendship is rarer than love.
author: Charles Péguy

text: Business, you know, may bring you money, but friendship hardly ever does.
author: Jane Austen

text: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
author: Hubert Humphrey

text: The strong bond of friendship is not always a balanced equation; friendship is not always about giving and taking in equal shares. Instead, friendship is grounded in a feeling that you know exactly who will be there for you when you need something, no matter what or when.
author: Simon Sinek

text: I define friendship as a bond that transcends all barriers. When you are ready to expect anything and everything from friends, good, bad or ugly... that's what I call true friendship.
author: Harbhajan Singh

text: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: However rare true love may be, it is less so than true friendship.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

text: Share your smile with the world. It's a symbol of friendship and peace.
author: Christie Brinkley

text: Remember that a gesture of friendship, no matter how small, is always appreciated.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

text: Friendship, like the immortality of the soul, is too good to be believed.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.
author: Cicero

text: True friends stab you in the front.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.
author: Confucius

text: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Every friendship goes through ups and downs. Dysfunctional patterns set in; external situations cause internal friction; you grow apart and then bounce back together.
author: Mariella Frostrup

text: Friendships are the family we make - not the one we inherit. I've always been someone to whom friendship, elective affinities, is as important as family.
author: Salman Rushdie

text: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
author: Henri Nouwen

text: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
author: John Wooden

text: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: It may happen sometimes that a long debate becomes the cause of a longer friendship. Commonly, those who dispute with one another at last agree.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: True happiness arises, in the first place, from the enjoyment of oneself, and in the next, from the friendship and conversation of a few select companions.
author: Joseph Addison

text: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
author: William C. Menninger

text: No person is your friend who demands your silence or denies your right to grow.
author: Alice Walker

text: Friendship is a strong and habitual inclination in two persons to promote the good and happiness of one another.
author: Eustace Budgell

text: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
author: Isocrates

text: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
author: Bruce Lee

text: I have learned that friendship isn't about who you've known the longest, it's about who came and never left your side.
author: Yolanda Hadid

text: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.
author: Henry van Dyke Jr.

text: Two of man's basic needs are to love and to share. Both of these needs are satisfied in greater or lesser degree by friendship.
author: Mother Angelica

text: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: In romance, we feel the need to zoom in and expound on our partner's foibles in intimate detail; in friendship, we tend to do the opposite, avoiding confrontation through fear, lethargy or both.
author: Mariella Frostrup

text: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Experts on romance say for a happy marriage there has to be more than a passionate love. For a lasting union, they insist, there must be a genuine liking for each other. Which, in my book, is a good definition for friendship.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: A friend to all is a friend to none.
author: Aristotle

text: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.
author: Plautus

text: Silence is the true friend that never betrays.
author: Confucius

text: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
author: Euripides

text: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.
author: Euripides

text: A friend is a gift you give yourself.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
author: Cicero

text: Every gift from a friend is a wish for your happiness.
author: Richard Bach

text: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: If you have one true friend, you have more than your share.
author: Thomas Fuller

text: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.
author: Henry Ford

text: I want my friend to miss me as long as I miss him.
author: Augustine of Hippo

text: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

text: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
author: Len Wein

text: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: A youth, when at home, should be filial and, abroad, respectful to his elders. He should be earnest and truthful. He should overflow in love to all and cultivate the friendship of the good. When he has time and opportunity, after the performance of these things, he should employ them in polite studies.
author: Confucius

text: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
author: Michel de Montaigne

text: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
author: Mencius

text: Sustaining true friendship is a lot more challenging than we give it credit for.
author: Mariella Frostrup

text: There is no friendship, no love, like that of the parent for the child.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: Acquaintances we meet, enjoy, and can easily leave behind; but friendship grows deep roots.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

text: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.
author: Giotto

text: Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends.
author: Shirley MacLaine

text: The fact is, with every friendship you make, and every bond of trust you establish, you are shaping the image of America projected to the rest of the world. That is so important. So when you study abroad, you're actually helping to make America stronger.
author: Michelle Obama

text: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
author: Walt Whitman

text: In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
author: Euripides

text: Friendship is held to be the severest test of character. It is easy, we think, to be loyal to a family and clan, whose blood is in your own veins.
author: Charles Eastman

text: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

text: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.
author: Hanya Yanagihara
